ygData.subject: RE: [EQ-Monks] Crescent Armor
ygData.msgSnippet: Depends on the situation. Not pulling, then the 15 ac 15str. Pulling, then the hp. Praelor Dileasai ... From: Sean O Brien [mailto:sobrien@nudgee.com] Sent:
ygData.messageBody:
Depends on the situation. Not pulling, then the 15 ac 15str. Pulling, then
the hp.

Praelor Dileasai

-----Original Message-----
From: Sean O'Brien [mailto:sobrien@...]
Sent: Monday, September 11, 2000 3:46 PM
To: EQ-Monks@egroups.com
Subject: Re: [EQ-Monks] Crescent Armor



Would you take ac15 12str or ac15 135hp

ibnalnoor@... wrote:
>
>
> I do not believe I have ever replied to something on this or if I have it
has been a very longtime. I just had to say though that when my STR is
buffed up I notice a dramatic increase in the number of times I hit and the
amount of damage I do. This is not strict scientific data not checked or
anything but I do know that all my highs I have ever jotted down with flying
kick and weapons attacks are all from when being buffed. If this is a
coincidence then so be it. I do know that the 110 hps more I get from
wearing Plat FO rings as opposed to any of the better STR rings does not
mean a whole lot to me. If one of the mobs in Seb decides it really wants to
rip into me with my HPs I am a lost cause anyways.
>
> AC is the top dog but beyond that choose what you want. Whatever
makes you happiest. I personally like AC/STR/MR. I just feel that even if it
boosts my chances to hit by one percent when I am wielding low delay low
damage weapons the more often I hit the more often I do my job which is
dealing damage. Lord knows Monks do not have the HPs to be a meat wall.
>
> Ibnalnoor
> 53rd lvl Monk
